content: [Units of measurement](/wiki/Units_of_measurement) used in [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) and neighbouring countries include the *[kati](/wiki/Catty)*, a unit of [mass](/wiki/Mass), and the *gantang*, a unit of [volume](/wiki/Volume). ## Mass For mass, the *[catty](/wiki/Catty)* equals 0.6 kg. Another unit is *[picul](/wiki/Picul)* which equals 60 kg. ## Volume The *gantang* is equivalent to an [imperial gallon](/wiki/Imperial_gallon), or 4.54609 cubic decimetres. Table of equivalences UnitImperial gallonMillilitres*kepul*1⁄16284.130625*leng*1⁄8568.26125*cupak*1⁄41136.5225*gantang*14546.09*sukat*418184.36*nalih*1672737.44*kunca*160727374.4**Note:** The millilitre equivalences are exact. - *Malay Fishermen: Their Peasant Economy*, by [Raymond Firth](/wiki/Raymond_Firth). Norton (1975) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 0-393-00775-8 This [unit of measurement](/wiki/Unit_of_measurement) related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Malay units of measurement
